Study Title: Accelerated Radiotherapy and Concomitant Chemo-radiotherapy in HNSCC
Brief Summary: This is a multicentric randomized phase III trial comparing conventional radiotherapy with concomitant chemotherapy versus accelerated radiotherapy with concomitant chemotherapy versus very accelerated radiotherapy in patients with stage III-IV head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. The main end point is the event free survival.
Interventions: PROCEDURE: Conventional radiotherapy 70 Gy in 7 weeks|PROCEDURE: middle accelerated radiotherapy 70 Gy in 6 weeks|PROCEDURE: very accelerated radiotherapy 64.8 Gy in 3.5 weeks|DRUG: 5FU, Paraplatin
Primary Outcome Measures: Event free survival (event=progression, relapse, death from any cause), 3 years
Secondary Outcome Measures: Survival, 3 years|Loco regional control, 3 years|Toxicity, early and late
Sponsor: Groupe Oncologie Radiotherapie Tete et Cou
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: CHU de Tours, Tours, 37 044, France|Institut Gustave Roussy, Villejuif, 94800, France
